metadata.title: CVE-2024-53157 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:firmware: arm_scpi: Check the DVFS OPP count returned by the firmwareFix a kernel crash with the below call trace when the SCPI firmwarereturns OPP count of zero.dvfs_info.opp_count may be zero on some platforms during the reboottest, and the kernel will crash after dereferencing the pointer tokcalloc(info->count, sizeof(*opp), GFP_KERNEL).  |  Unable to handle kernel NULL pointer dereference at virtual address0000000000000028  |  Mem abort info:  |    ESR = 0x96000004  |    Exception class = DABT (current EL), IL = 32 bits  |    SET = 0, FnV = 0  |    EA = 0, S1PTW = 0  |  Data abort info:  |    ISV = 0, ISS = 0x00000004  |    CM = 0, WnR = 0  |  user pgtable: 4k pages, 48-bit VAs, pgdp = 00000000faefa08c  |  [0000000000000028] pgd=0000000000000000  |  Internal error: Oops: 96000004 [#1] SMP  |  scpi-hwmon: probe of PHYT000D:00 failed with error -110  |  Process systemd-udevd (pid: 1701, stack limit = 0x00000000aaede86c)  |  CPU: 2 PID: 1701 Comm: systemd-udevd Not tainted 4.19.90+ #1  |  Hardware name: PHYTIUM LTD Phytium FT2000/4/Phytium FT2000/4, BIOS  |
